required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Single-Use Negative Pressure Wound Therapy System vs. Traditional Negative Pressure Wound Therapy System (tNPWT)
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective, Randomized, Comparative Effectiveness Study of a Single-Use, Negative Pressure Wound Therapy System (PICO) Versus a Traditional Negative Pressure Wound Therapy System (tNPWT) in the Treatment of Lower Extremity Ulcers

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to compare the clinical efficacy of two types of NPWT systems; the traditional negative pressure wound therapy (tNPWT) system and the single-use negative pressure wound therapy (PICO) system.

detailed_description.textblock: The two types of NPWT systems include the tNPWT system that has successfully completed a coding verification request with CMS and has the following capabilities (e.g., range of negative pressure, connective tubing, canister, foam or gauze filler, and approved for home use), and a portable, canister-less, battery operated, disposable PICO system to see if there are any observed differences with regard to the clinical efficacy of the two devices.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Ulcer Area From Baseline to the End of the Treatment Period
primary_outcome.description: Ulcer area was photographed in order to determine the measurements of the post-debridement ulcer area (cm^2 and total percentage [%]) using the ARANZ Silhouette wound imaging and measurement device.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage Change in Ulcer Area From Baseline to the End of the Treatment Period
primary_outcome.description: Ulcer area was photographed in order to determine the measurements of the postdebridement ulcer area (cm^2 and total percentage [%]) using the ARANZ Silhouette wound imaging and measurement device.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Target Ulcer Depth Following Treatment With Either PICO or tNPWT From Baseline Over the 12-week Treatment Period
secondary_outcome.description: Ulcer area was analyzed for depth measurement in millimeters (mm), volume measurement in cubic centimeters (cm^3), and percentage change (%) including terms for treatment, baseline depth, baseline volume, wound type, pooled sites, and wound duration using the ARANZ Silhouette wound imaging and measurement device.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Target Ulcer Volume Following Treatment With Either PICO or tNPWT From Baseline Over the 12-week Treatment Period
secondary_outcome.description: Ulcer area was analyzed for depth measurement in millimeters (mm), volume measurement in cubic centimeters (cm^3), and percentage change (%) including terms for treatment, baseline depth, baseline volume, wound type, pooled sites, and wound duration using the ARANZ Silhouette wound imaging and measurement device.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage Change in Target Ulcer Depth and Volume Following Treatment With Either PICO or tNPWT From Baseline Over the 12-week Treatment Period
secondary_outcome.description: Ulcer area was analyzed for depth measurement in millimeters (mm), volume measurement in cubic centimeters (cm^3), and percentage change (%) including terms for treatment, baseline depth, baseline volume, wound type, pooled sites, and wound duration using the ARANZ Silhouette wound imaging and measurement device.

arm_group.description: Negative Pressure Wound Therapy (NPWT) at 80mmHg (nominal) +/- 20 mmHg to the wound surface

Traditional NPWT (tNPWT) from -25 mmHg and up to -200 mmHg; intensity settings of either low, medium and high; delivery modes of continuous or intermittent. The pressure, intensity and delivery settings will be left to the Investigator's discretion at each study treatment visit.

intervention.description: Negative Pressure Wound Therapy (NPWT) at 80mmHg (nominal) +/- 20 mmHg to the wound surface

NPWT from -25 mmHg and up to -200 mmHg; intensity settings of either low, medium and high; delivery modes of continuous or intermittent. The pressure, intensity and delivery settings will be left to the Investigator's discretion at each study treatment visit.

criteria.textblock:
INCLUSION CRITERIA:
- Provide informed consent
- Age ≥ 18 years and of either sex
- Willing to comply with protocol instructions, including allowing all study assessments
- Have a Venous Leg Ulcer (VLU) between the knee and ankle (at or above the malleolus), with a surface area ≥ 2.0 cm2 and ≤ 36.0 cm2
- Target ulcer duration ≥ 4 weeks but ≤ 104 weeks (24 months)
- Have a Diabetic Foot Ulcer (DFU) present on any part of the plantar or dorsum surface of the foot, with a surface area ≥ 0.5 cm2 and ≤ 10.0 cm2
- Target ulcer involves a full thickness skin loss, but WITHOUT exposure of tendon, muscle, or bone
- Target ulcer duration ≥ 4 weeks but ≤ 52 weeks (12 months)
- Acceptable state of health and nutrition
EXCLUSION CRITERIA
- Therapy with another investigational agent within thirty (30) days of Screening, or during the study Ulcers which are deemed as highly exuding, per the Investigator's discretion.
- Current diagnosis of osteomyelitis at the target wound location that is not currently receiving treatment [Documented history of resolved osteomyelitis is allowed].
- Subjects with a VLU: Refusal of or inability to tolerate compression therapy.
- Clinical evidence of target ulcer infection
- Current systemic therapy with cytotoxic drugs.
- Current therapy with chronic (> 10 days) oral corticosteroids.
- Previous treatment with NPWT device or hyperbaric oxygen within 7 days of screening.
- Malignancy in the target ulcer, or history of cancer in the preceding 5 years (other than carcinoma in situ of the cervix or adequately treated non-melanoma skin cancers)

facility.name: NW University Feinberg School of Medicine
Rosalind Franklin University of Med & Science
Centre podiatrique et soins des plaies

group.title: PICO System
group.description: Subjects randomized to receive the PICO system applied to the target ulcer area over the 12-week treatment period from Baseline.

group.title: tNPWT System
group.description: Subjects randomized to receive the tNPWT system applied to the target ulcer area over the 12-week treatment period from Baseline.

participants_list.participants: The Safety analysis included 164, ITT was 161, and Per Protocol was 115 subjects (total both arms).

baseline.population: The Safety analysis included all enrolled subjects (N=164), however, 3 subjects did not complete a follow-up visit and thus were excluded from all Baseline and Outcome Measure analyses.

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Change in Ulcer Area From Baseline to the End of the Treatment Period
outcome.description: Ulcer area was photographed in order to determine the measurements of the post-debridement ulcer area (cm^2 and total percentage [%]) using the ARANZ Silhouette wound imaging and measurement device.
outcome.population: The Per-Protocol (PP) population was used to analyze outcome measure data and included all subjects who were randomized, met inclusion/exclusion criteria, had not discontinued treatment within the first 9 weeks (-1 day), and had no significant protocol deviations.

analysis.groups_desc: Percentage change in wound area from Baseline to end of 12-week treatment period (PP population - all wounds)
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Stepwise regression method - Primary efficacy analysis, difference between treatment groups in percentage change in wound area from baseline visit to end of 12-week treatment period for the PP population.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events were collected from Baseline through 12 weeks of treatment or study withdrawal, whichever came first.

group.title: PICO System
group.description: Subjects randomized to receive the PICO system applied to the target ulcer area over the 12-week treatment period from Baseline.

group.title: tNPWT System

event.sub_title: Acute on chronic congestive heart failure
Left medial ankle venous leg ulcer bacterial colonization of wound bed
Abrasion at 10 o'clock from left distal dorsal TMA
Probable osteomyelitis right foot at target ulcer
Left ankle and lower leg pain
Episode of recurrent major depressive disorder
Target ulcer increase in size > 75% from Baseline
Excessive intermittent maceration right plantar forefoot target ulcer
event.description: Intermittent events caused intermittent stoppages in therapy. The AE was considered mild.

event.sub_title: Subject could not tolerated NPWT, it was uncomfortable for the subject
Cellulitis of left plantar medial midfoot
Right thigh fluid collection with right groin incision site related drainage
Allergic contact dermatitis of the right leg
Allergic contact dermatitis of skin surrounding right foot ulcer
Regression in wound - size of wound increased by more than 75% from last visit
Redness, swelling, and discomfort right leg
Progressive disease - worsening of target ulcer causing subject to be discontinued from study
New non-target ulcer near target ulcer on right shin
New non-target ulcer near target ulcer 0.5 cm in size
Non-target ulcer on lateral side of left leg
Multiple skin tears around target ulcer site
Water blister on medial side of left leg
Skin tear adjacent to target ulcer on left leg
Three skin tears 2 cm away from target wound
Non-target wound on right lateral ankle
Two skin tears away from target wound (anterior)
Two skin tears posterior to left leg
Multple skin tears from target wound anterior left leg
Small irritations around where dressing puts pressure on left leg
Venous ulcer right leg malleolus increase in wound size
Peri-wound inflammation target leg left VLU
Large amount of drainage from target ulcer, left leg calf
Foot blistering on dorsal and medial surface
Formed a blister on anterior shin from tNPWT bridge
Venous leg ulcer on left lateral leg
Ulcer on dorsal portion of right foot
Left side of nose epidermal inclusion cyst
Left lower abdomen epidermal cyst inflamed
Progressive disease - wound size met the definition of progressive disease
Burning pain in foot of target ulcer
Reopening of ulcers on target limb
Worsening of recurring non-target ulcers on target limb
Redness, skin breakdown to target limb
Deep venous thrombosis right lower leg

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: There were no known limitations or caveats reported during this study.
